synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involves three main steps: 1) sulfide ready-mixed operation where lithium sulfide and phosphoric sulfide are weighed, mixed, and ball-milled to obtain a ternary mixture, 2) secondary high-energy ball milling operation where the mixture is combined with silver powders and subjected to high-energy dry ball milling to create an amorphous composite, and 3) evolution reaction operation in situ where the composite is heat-treated to produce a lithium sulfide system solid electrolyte material containing silver halogen compounds.
